clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Leg Elevation on Prevention of Intraoperative Hypotension During Beach Chair Position
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Leg Elevation on the Prevention of Intraoperative Hypotension During Shoulder Surgery in the Beach Chair Position

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to evaluate the effect of leg elevation on the prevention of intraoperative hypotension during shoulder surgery in the Beach-chair position. patients undergoing shoulder surgery in the Beach-chair position will be randomly assigned to Group L (with leg elevation) or Group C (no intervention). The primary outcome is the incidence of intraoperative hypotension (mean blood pressure < 60mmHg or systolic blood pressure < 80% of baseline). Secondary outcomes are the incidence of intraoperative cerebral desaturation (cerebral oxygen saturation < 80% of baseline, longer than 30 seconds), total amounts of administered inotropic agents, and systolic blood pressure, heart rate, and cerebral oxygen saturation at various time points.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From beach chair positioning to the end of surgery (average of 1 hour up to 2 hours)
primary_outcome.description: Mean blood pressure < 60 mmHg or systolic blood pressure < 80% of baseline

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From beach chair positioning to the end of surgery (average of 1 hour up to 2 hours)
secondary_outcome.description: Cerebral oxygen saturation < 80% of baseline longer than 30 seconds

secondary_outcome.measure: Total amounts of administered inotropic agents
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From beach chair positioning to the end of surgery (average of 1 hour up to 2 hours)
secondary_outcome.description: Total amounts of administered inotropic agents after the Beach-chair positioning

secondary_outcome.time_frame: before induction(baseline) / before the Beach-chair positioning / 1,5,30 and 60 minutes after the Beach-chair positioning
secondary_outcome.description: Systolic blood pressure in mmHg at multiple time-points

secondary_outcome.time_frame: before induction(baseline) / before the Beach-chair positioning / 1,5,30 and 60 minutes after the Beach-chair positioning
secondary_outcome.description: Heart rate in bpm at multiple time-points

secondary_outcome.time_frame: before induction(baseline) / before the Beach-chair positioning / 1,5,30 and 60 minutes after the Beach-chair positioning
secondary_outcome.description: Peripheral oxygen saturation in percentage at multiple time-points

secondary_outcome.time_frame: before induction(baseline) / before the Beach-chair positioning / 1,5,30 and 60 minutes after the Beach-chair positioning
secondary_outcome.description: Cerebral oxygen saturation in percentage at multiple time-points

arm_group.description: leg elevation during the beach chair position
Patients' leg will be straightened without any intervention.

intervention.description: Patients' leg will be raised by a pillow under both legs and the hip and knee joints will be flexed 45 degrees to position both knees at the heart level.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- adult patients undergoing shoulder surgery in the beach chair position
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with myocardial infarction
- Patients with pacemaker
- Patients with cerebrovascular disease
- patients with arteriovenous fistula at the opposite arm
- Patients with autonomic nerve disorders
- Patients with hip or knee joint disorder limiting hip or knee flexion
- BMI > 30 kg/m2
